enWisdom: Hope deceives and lifetime passes

Wisdom: أَكْذِبِ الْأَمَلَ وَلَا تَثِقْ بِهِ فَإِنَّهُ غَرُورٌ وَصَاحِبُهُ مَغْرُورٌ
enWisdom: Belie hope and do not trust it, for it is a deception and he who possesses it is deceived
Aspirations may deceive
Hope is sufficient as a deception
For every hope there is a delusion
Aspirations are scattered [and dispersed]
Desire is the key to difficulty [and hardship]
Time wears out the bodies, renews hopes, brings death closer and takes aspirations further away
Be wary of [false] aspirations, for verily they are certain [causes of] deaths
With the realization of hopes, it becomes easier to overcome [one’s] fears

Wisdom: تَجَنَّبُوا الْمُنَى فَإِنَّهَا تَذْهَبُ بِبَهْجَةِ نِعَمِ اللَّهِ عِنْدَكُمْ وَتُلْزِمُ اسْتِصْغَارَهَا لَدَيْكُمْ وَعَلَى قِلَّةِ الشُّكْرِ مِنْكُمْ
enWisdom: Keep away from vain hopes, for they take away the delight of the blessings of Allah from you and make them seem small and insignificant, thereby increasing your lack of gratitude
The fruit of desire is hardship
The product of aspirations is regret
The product of aspiration is regret (and its fruit is loss)
The humiliation of men is in the dashing of hopes

Wisdom: كُلَّمَا عَظُمَ قَدْرُ الشَّيْ‏ءِ الْمُنَافَسِ عَلَيْهِ عَظُمَتِ الرَّزِيَّةُ لِفَقْدِهِ
enWisdom: Every time the value of a thing that is competed becomes great, the difficulty of losing it increases
One whose aspirations increase, his satisfaction decreases
One who follows his aspirations faces increased hardship
One whose aspirations increase, his hardship increases

Wisdom: مَنْ طَلَبَ مَا لَا يَكُونُ ضَيَّعَ مَطْلَبَهُ
enWisdom: One who seeks that which is impossible loses his quest
One who seeks support from his aspirations becomes penniless
Do not hope in that which will cause you to receive rebuke for your hope

Wisdom: مَنْ رَأَى الْمَوْتَ بِعَيْنِ أَمَلِهِ رَآهُ بَعِيداً
enWisdom: One who sees death with the eyes of his hope, sees it far away
